Tutorials

All 2D images Photoshop annotation cuneiform linguistics

Assembling Photographed Views of Cuneiform Tablets with Photoshop

Luis Sáenz, Louis Happel, Mathilde Touillon-Ricci, Alberto Giannese, Jonathan Taylor, Enrique Jiménez April 25, 2025 cuneiform, Photoshop, 2D images

Under peer review

This tutorial provides a step-by-step guide on assembling and processing photographed views of cuneiform tablets using Photoshop, with a focus on automation to ensure efficiency and standardization. It covers essential tasks like converting image formats, adding scales, and stitching photos, while also offering troubleshooting advice for manual corrections.

How to Annotate Cuneiform Texts

Matthew Ong October 06, 2023 cuneiform, annotation, linguistics doi

A high level overview of how to annotate a cuneiform text for linguistic content.

Contact us

For any questions about OpenDANES, or to join the DANES discord channel or mailing list, send us an email at the Digital Pasts Lab (digpasts@gmail.com)

OpenDANES is a platform for tutorials and white papers about using computational methodologies for ancient Near Eastern studies
